docs.lead_paragraph: Vanished child case delays film premiere, London Film Festival to open in October, a rush for Led Zeppelin seats and more culture news.

docs.lead_paragraph: Foxy Brown's next issue will be an album, not a baby. Although the rapper's defense lawyers said in court last month that she was three months pregnant, her manager, ChazWilliams, issued a statement on Wednesday saying, ''And to the pregnancy rumors, this is the official statement: She is not pregnant.'' Mr. Williams and Koch Records also announced that Ms. Brown, above, whose real name is Inga Marchand, would release the album ''Brooklyn's Don Diva'' on Nov. 20, while serving a one-year jail sentence. Last Friday Ms. Brown was sentenced for violating probation arising from a fight with two manicurists in a nail salon in New York three years ago. ''This is just a temporary situation,'' she said in a statement. ''I made my bed and have no problem lying in it. My will is steady. What doesn't kill me will only make me stronger.''
docs.abstract: Arts, Briefly column; manager Chaz Williams quashes rumors that Foxy Brown, sentenced to jail for violating probation, is pregnant; photo (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: Because there is no consensus on the issue of when life begins, a doctor does not have to tell a woman considering an abortion that the procedure would result in “killing an existing human being,” the court said.

headline.main: New Jersey’s Top Court Rejects Suit on Abortion
headline.print_headline: New Jersey Top Court Rejects Woman’s Malpractice Suit on Abortion

docs.snippet: Because there is no consensus on the issue of when life begins, a doctor does not have to tell a woman considering an abortion that the procedure would result in “killing an existing human being,” the court said.

docs.lead_paragraph: A doctor is under no obligation to tell a pregnant woman that she is carrying “an existing human being” before performing an abortion, the New Jersey Supreme Court ruled.

headline.main: Court Won’t Rule on Life’s Beginning
headline.print_headline: N.J. Court Refuses to Rule When Life Begins

docs.snippet: A doctor is under no obligation to tell a pregnant woman that she is carrying “an existing human being” before performing an abortion, the New Jersey Supreme Court ruled.

docs.lead_paragraph: Jane Wyman won an Oscar for her performance in the movie “Johnny Belinda” and was the first wife of President Ronald Reagan.

docs.lead_paragraph: Pregnant women and those who have recently given birth commonly have dreams in which their baby is in danger, a new study suggests.

headline.main: Having a Baby: Anxious Dreams Common in Early Motherhood
headline.print_headline: Anxious Dreams Common In Early Motherhood
